public class RestClient extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent
A client for easy interaction with KivaKit RestServices.

The constructor of this class takes a ObjectSerializer to read and write JSON, a Port specifying the host and port number to communicate with, and a Version specifying the version of the REST server. The get(String, Class) method reads a JSON object of the given type from a path relative to the server specified in the constructor. The post(String, Class, MicroservletRequest) method posts the given request object to the given path as JSON and then reads a JSON object response.

Creation

  • RestClient(ObjectSerializer, Port, Version)

Properties

  • serverVersion()

HTTP Requests

  • get(String, Class)
  • post(String, Class)
  • post(String, Class, MicroservletRequest)
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • RestClient

      public RestClient(@NotNull @NotNull com.telenav.kivakit.resource.serialization.ObjectSerializer serializer, @NotNull @NotNull com.telenav.kivakit.network.core.Port port, @NotNull @NotNull com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Version serverVersion)

      serializer - JSON serialization
      port - The (host and) port of the remote REST service to communicate with

  • Method Details

    • get

      public <Response extends MicroservletResponse> Response get(String path, Class<Response> responseType)
      Uses HTTP GET to read a JSON object of the given type from the given path.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to the microservlet request handler. If the path is not absolute (doesn't start with a '/'), it is prefixed with: "/api/[major.version].[minor.version]/". For example, the path "users" in microservlet version 3.1 will resolve to "/api/3.1/users", and the path "/users" will resolve to "/users".
      responseType - The type of object to read. Must be a subclass of MicroservletResponse.
      Returns:
      The response object, or null if a failure occurred

    • post

      public <Request extends MicroservletRequest, Response extends MicroservletResponse> Response post(String path, Class<Response> responseType)
      Convenience method when "posting" a JSON object using path parameters

    • post

      public <Request extends MicroservletRequest, Response extends MicroservletResponse> Response post(String path, Class<Response> responseType, Request request)
      Uses HTTP POST to write the given object to read a JSON object of the given type from the given path.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to the microservlet request handler. If the path is not absolute (doesn't start with a '/'), it is prefixed with: "/api/[major.version].[minor.version]/". For example, the path "users" in microservlet version 3.1 will resolve to "/api/3.1/users", and the path "/users" will resolve to "/users".
      responseType - The type of object to read. Must be a subclass of MicroservletResponse.
      request - The request object to post as application/json to the given path. If the request is null, then the path or query parameters contains the data to be deserialized into JSON.
      Returns:
      The response object or null if a failure occurred

    • serverVersion

      public com.telenav.kivakit.core.version.Version serverVersion()
      Returns the version of the remote server that this client is interacting with. The version is specified during construction.
